page.title: 06HOUSING IN GOOLE
page.content: The{oldest housing}in Goole is about 150 years old, in the docks area. Few are residential today but are business premises, some of which have flats above. Housing from 1840 to 1890 is much more evident, mostly still occupied. These were built as{worker's}brick terraces with grey slate roofs. Much building took place from about 1880 to 1910 in the new{business centre round the station. Many{council houses,}both terraced and semi-detached, were built between 1930 and 1960. More expensive,{private,}detached and semi-detached houses, built of brick and pebble-dash, were erected between 1920 and 1950 on roads leading out of town. Modern{estates}and developments are currently being planned and built.
